AA
The UK's largest motoring organisation unites their trainee driving instructors on one central platform, encouraging social learning and achieving 75% customer growth with Thrive
With over one hundred years in operation, the AA is arguably the most recognisable name in the UK when it comes to breakdown cover. Since their founding in 1905, the UK's largest motoring organisation has extended their portfolio to include finance, leisure and lifestyle services, along with their very own driving school. At the heart of the school, the trainee instructors are guided by the AAâs expert courses - allowing them to eventually become franchisees, and pass that knowledge on to students.
User Licenses
2,000
Region
EMEA
Legacy Platform
None
Use Case
Communication
Compliance training
Social learning
Customer service training
Training
Links
â
Ready for anything
â
â
The AA Driving Instructor Training Academy had thousands of trainee instructors on the books, with account managers handling hundreds of people each. Their aim was to give each of their learners the best, most consistent experience and opportunities for success, no matter where and when they chose to learn. And with so many trainees to keep track of, they had their work cut out for them.
While trainees were enthusiastic about becoming franchised instructors, the process itself had a few issues. Firstly, the task of obtaining each traineeâs information proved too lengthy. Next, to become a franchisee could take anywhere between 18 months and 2 years to complete.
All of this combined led to uninspired trainees, and the team observed a lot of people beginning the course but not finishing it. Or worse still, some would register but never even start.
The abundance of useful information provided by the AA was not best served in the long, text-based handouts it took the form of, across multiple channels. This medium hardly inspired the sense of fun, ease and engagement that the AA wanted to instil in their trainees.
Mark Born
(Head of the AA Driving Instructor Training Academy) knew there was a better way to deliver their important information, and actually make it land. Something needed to change in order for the AA Driving Instructor Training Academy to fully embody the companyâs motto, and truly be
âready for anything.â
â
Customer growth
75%
customer growth achieved in last 12 months with Thrive
â
Training resources
2,222
training resources hosted on platform
â
Content views
300,000
content views in 2023
â
The road to success
â
With a desire to shift their communication from various Facebook groups to one central and internal platform, the need for social learning, and a commitment to giving their driving students the very best instruction possible, Thrive was the obvious choice for AAâs next steps.
In launching the platform, the AA Driving School had clear goals they wanted to achieve. They could plainly see the issues that needed fixing in their current processes to help their course material shine through in the way it deserved: trainees could not identify what was expected of them, or easily navigate the courses themselves.
â
On top of this, a lack of interaction with the brand left trainees feeling relatively disconnected. The AA wanted to see an uptick in instructors completing the courses to a higher level, provide a clearer structure, and encourage communication.
In order to give their instructors the very best start possible, the AA needed to harness Thriveâs functionality and bring their courses into the future.
"[Thrive] works so hard for our trainees to make sure that they can get the best resources, the best updated videos, the best updated information that they need throughout their journey."
- Farideh Sarvari, Driving Instructor Trainer
â
Driving engagement
â
Thrive has been instrumental in helping the AA bring their Driving School up to the same standard as the rest of their impressive portfolio.
Transferring the training materials onto the digital platform, Thrive and AA worked together to make every step as engaging and effective as possible. Hosting a range of videos, quizzes and PDFâs, the platform provides flexibility for every individual learner - no matter their needs or learning preferences.
Trainees are now regularly interacting with AA-branded content, meaning they feel more connected to the business than ever before.
For every solution the Driving School sought, Thrive had features to suit.
â
Compliance:
The AA has left the struggle of keeping track of their trainee instructors in the past. With Thriveâs Managerâs Dashboard feature, they can follow along with their progress and offer them any extra help when needed.
â
Communication and social learning
Gone are the disparate Facebook groups the AA was using to communicate with their trainees. All communication has now shifted to Thrive, meaning everything is in one central place. The platform has provided a clear course structure, in a concise and easy-to-understand way.
The platformâs social-media-like functionality means that not only is it easy to use, but the trainees actively
want to.
It seamlessly mimics the effortlessness of platforms that people are already used to in their personal lives, encouraging trainees to like, share and comment on the learning materials that matter most to them.
The move has helped to foster the sense of community the AA was aiming for: now, the team has created individual communities within the platform to support trainees at each stage in their journey towards gaining the qualification. Whether itâs to celebrate success, seek support, connect with peers going through the same process, or share best practices from those who have already succeeded, the platform has successfully brought trainees together.
2,222
training resources are now hosted on the platform, with a total of
501,592
content views and counting. The sense of social learning and knowledge sharing the AA set out for has been achieved, with the platform boasting
2,687
likes,
2,851
shares and
8,014
comments since launch. Â
Altogether, this has resulted in the AA succeeding in their goal of helping trainees achieve a higher level than before the launch of Thrive.
â
Customer service
How does learning directly lead to customer success?
Since AA has been using Thrive to deliver their valuable learning material in the best possible way, their instructors can then provide the best and most consistent customer service to their students. As a result, the AA has achieved 75% customer growth in just 12 months, and gained a Platinum Feefo Award for outstanding customer service.
Mark believes this achievement to be thanks in part to Thrive:
"We're really proud of the fact that we've earned a Platinum Feefo Award, which means we've had gold-trusted service for the last three years. The fact that we've got the learning platform really helps us with that, because the engagement is always there. We can always have those conversations, and give everyone that visibility. Thrive has absolutely helped us with those Feefo awards."
- Mark Born, Head of the AA Driving Instructor Training Academy
Whatâs next?
â
As the customer base grows, so does the team. The AA has hired their first ever Community Manager to own all communication through Thrive, and help achieve their goal of strengthening the driver community.
Thriveâs ongoing customer support means that the AA can feel safe in the knowledge that they always have someone in their corner. Working together, they have plenty of ideas about how to continue getting the most out of their platform.
Next on the agenda: the AA hopes to shorten the amount of time between sign-up and course completion. Using Thriveâs comms tools and with the help of their new Community Manager, they want to develop their community even further - uniting their budding instructors from all over the country.

Princes
The food and drink manufacturer unites their global teams in one central place and encourages knowledge-sharing with Thrive.
Recognised globally for their kitchen cupboard mainstays, Princes is a food and drink manufacturer boasting a product portfolio of over 350 brands. From their extremely popular tuna, to Napolina chopped tomatoes and Branston beans, the culinary giants play a starring role in pantries the world over. Of course, their significant operation requires a large and dispersed workforce to facilitate it. From the UK, to Poland, to Mauritius, to Italy and the Netherlands, their team of 7,000 people reach out across the globe to work together and keep everything running smoothly. Global teams bring a diverse set of skills, approaches and knowledge - the perfect combination for an international operation like Princes. But with everyone so spread out, they needed a learning platform that would unite their people in one central place.
User Licenses
5,000
Region
EMEA
Legacy Platform
LMS365
Use Case
Employee engagement
Skills development
Leadership development
Deskless workforce
Links
What do we want to be known for?
Adele Spencer
(Head of L&D) and
Steven Park
(Digital Learning Manager) knew their digital learning strategy needed an overhaul. They began by taking stock of what they already had, and using that information to figure out exactly what they needed. They asked themselves the question:
âAs a learning function, what do we want to be known for?â
Their existing platform took a traditional, compliance based approach. While this meant that most of their team received the necessary training, it didnât fit within the bold digital learning strategy they envisioned. Along with a lack of inspiration and innovation, the platform simply wasnât fit for purpose: a SharePoint based site with a distinct lack of licences, some of the workforce couldnât even access it.
They could clearly see the current platform wasnât going to help them reach their goal as a learning function: to be inclusive, engaging, and accessible to everyone. They wanted a platform that would truly support this vision, and bring their workforce together from all over the world.
â
A new taste for training
Steven had worked with Thrive at a previous company, and so he knew what Princes could achieve using the platform. His research continually returned him to Thrive: a partner with whom heâd built a strong, productive relationship. This ultimately helped them stand out from the crowd. Thriveâs functionality, features and entire ethos Â just seemed to slot perfectly into what Princes needed, making the partnership a no-brainer.
Adoption rate
93%
adoption rate in 12 months
â
Active users
Over
3,000
active users across UK, EU & Mauritius
â
Content views
Over
100,000
content views
â
All the ingredients for a perfect partnership
Transitioning to a new learning platform can be a stressful process. With existing data and learning history to migrate, apps to integrate, and the implementation to complete, there are a lot of plates that need spinning.
Luckily, Steven and Adele knew they were in safe hands.
Thriveâs thorough, structured approach was exactly what Princes needed to make sure the entire transition went off without a hitch. With their very own
Implementation Specialist
, a dedicated Customer Success Manager, and regular face-to-face meetings, the Thrive team acted as an extension of Princes - and from day one to launch, everyone was on the same page.
To take care of all the technical details, Thrive worked together with Princesâ key stakeholders and made sure that Steven and Adele could focus purely on the learning.
â
Food for thought
One of the main objectives when launching the platform was to encourage better communication and collaboration between every single Princes employee. They wanted to make sure that everyone felt truly a part of the brand, and Thrive has allowed them to do just that.
Using Thriveâs
Broadcast
feature, Princes holds a bi-weekly event called
Food for Thought.
During this company-wide event, people from all over the business are brought together virtually to discuss the various projects, business initiatives and ideas that are helping to keep Princes at the forefront of their industry.
From sustainability efforts in Mauritius to European packaging methods, knowledge is shared with absolutely everyone in the company - so no matter their department, people feel connected to every facet of the operation.
This regular event has helped to encourage the sense of knowledge-sharing and collaboration that Adele and Steven had hoped for when embarking on the launch of a new platform.
Itâs made even better with the
Thrive Mobile App
. For factory operatives and other deskless employees, regularly interacting with Princesâ content and branding via the app helps them to feel connected to the business, instead of simply doing their job in a vacuum.
â
â
Pull vs. Push
One of the most impactful innovations within the business has been the welcome move towards âpullâ learning, instead of just âpush.â In other words, Princesâ learners are now able to decide for themselves when and what would be most helpful for them to learn, instead of simply being told what to do.
â
Through the use of
Thrive Content
- Thriveâs off-the-shelf content solution with thousands of pre-made resources - Princes can be confident that their learning content is consistently fresh, exciting and relevant to their end users. Princes even contributed to Thrive's
Food and Drink Manufacturing content suite
, so the partnership is going from strength to strength. Thrive keeps ahead of the news and trends within L&D, meaning Princes is also always one step ahead.
Going forward, Adele and Steven plan to use Thrive to achieve a people-driven culture at Princes. Through mapping soft skills to company behaviours and values, they hope to set expectations for the way they want people to communicate with one another.
And with Thriveâs Skills and Goals functionality, managers can use 1:1âs to identify areas for improvement before sending employees in the direction of relevant learning pathways.
The partnership with Thrive has been so successful that Princes even uses it as a part of their recruitment strategy. In Adeleâs words:
âWe tell new candidates that we use Thrive as a platform, because we see it as being an attraction tool for helping us get people that we want on board with us at Princes.â
Weâre thrilled Princes chose Thrive as a key ingredient in their recipe for learning success.

Leigh Academies Trust
The multi-academy trust uses Thrive's smooth implementation to launch an innovative digital learning strategy to thousands of employees.
Uniting 31 schools from across Kent, South East London and Medway, Leigh Academies Trustâs mission is to deliver âeducation for a better world.â Their purpose is one of inclusivity: Their multi-academy trust comprises primary, secondary and special academies to ensure every student is set up with the very best start in life - regardless of their needs or background. At the heart of the trust, a 3,000+ strong team keeps the operation running smoothly. Leigh Academies Trust recognises that in order to prioritise the development of their students, they first need to prioritise the development of their staff. Thatâs where Thrive comes in.

Education for everyone
Leigh Academies Trust
is a vast, wide-reaching organisation with no plans of slowing down. The trust comprises
31 schools made up of 20,000 students,
and it was essential that their learning platform was able to support this scale - even as it grew.
Richard Taylor
(People and Communications Director) and
Adam Waters
(Learning & Development Manager) knew their current learning platform wasnât up to the standard they needed for their staff: Adoption was low, and as an organisation with learning at the very heart of their mission they needed a learning platform that reflected that.

An unfair competition
Knowing that the marketplace was crowded, Richard decided to speak to his peers in other academies to gain recommendations for their sector - and Thrive kept coming up in the conversation.
The multiple reviews were too much to ignore, and after seeing Thriveâs impressive
roster of customers
Richard and his team booked a demo.
The highly personalised and accessible demo from Account Executive
Danny Braithwaite
was, in Richardâs words, âunfair for the competition.â Danny helped the Leigh Academies Trust team visualise their learning and development strategy in a vivid and tangible way, answering every question they had and even building them their own portal full of all the information they might need going forward.
Finally, the price transparency and value for money clinched the deal.
âWhen we initially went into the process, we expected Thrive to be the most expensive, based on what weâd seen in terms of the quality of the platform. But actually, it came out the most cost-effective.â
- Richard Taylor, People and Communications Director at Leigh Academies Trust
Going into the partnership with Thrive, the team at Leigh Academies Trust had some understandable concerns about the sheer scale of their operation. Would the all-important implementation go to plan, and launch successfully in time?
â
â
The power of a successful implementation
A successful and smooth implementation of Leigh Academy Trustâs new learning platform was the key to pulling off a September launch.
The turnaround was tight. With all their teachers coming back from summer break for the INSET Day in September, the platform needed to be up and running to support their staff in the new academic year.
Not only that, but it was extremely important to Richard and his team that the teachers would not return to a blank platform. It needed to serve as an inviting, engaging prospect packed with helpful content for their teachers.
The process was made easy with Thriveâs laser-focused, structured approach; a match made in heaven for a meticulous operation like Leigh Academies Trust.
Steps for a smooth implementation
So, how did Thrive and Leigh Academies Trust approach this crucial step in the process? There were a few key factors that contributed to a smooth, seamless implementation.
â
Account Executive:
Thanks to their personal Account Executive Danny, the implementation started early - during the sales process. Through the highly personalised portal, the team was able to get to grips with the functionality so that when it came to the implementation itself, they could navigate their way around the platform with ease.
â
Dedicated Implementation Specialist:
With a dedicated Implementation Specialist in
Georgia Avery
, Richard and his team could relax knowing that a typically stressful task (i.e. migrating everything onto a new learning platform and rolling it out to thousands of staff) would be made easy. Georgiaâs approach was purposely hands-on, which allowed her to collaborate with the trust and show them exactly how to handle each step.
And thanks to the early access they had to Thriveâs wealth of resources, they were able to take their training into their own hands to understand every facet of the platform before launch.
â
Working together to establish needs and time-frames:
Throughout the entire implementation process, Thrive stayed in close contact with the team to make sure they were supported every step of the way. It was important that everybody understood what was needed, the expected time-frame, the steps to take post-launch, and the success metrics by which to measure them. Their Thrive Customer Success Team helped them establish what was important to them, including user completions, engagement, User Generated Content and social interaction.
Thriveâs implementation team served as an extension of Leigh Academy Trustâs internal team. The trust leant on their experience and knowledge to get everything done in a timely manner - and thatâs how together, they were able to pull off a September launch.
At the moment of launch just before INSET Day, the team crossed their fingers and held their breath as they hoped for a smooth roll outâ¦
â
â
A successful launch
â¦ Luckily, the launch went off without a hitch, allowing the Leigh Academies Trust team to breathe a sigh of relief.
With students to teach, lessons to plan and a never-ending stream of homework to mark, teachers are incredibly busy people. The Leigh Academies Trust team had some trepidation that the learning platform would serve as just another item on their ever-growing to-do list - but luckily, their concerns were put at ease upon the launch of Thrive.
It was clear from the get-go that their teachers and staff truly understood the value of the platform, immediately engaging with the content that came pre-loaded thanks to the team at
Thrive Content
. The teachers could use the two INSET Days to focus their attention on their own learning before turning it to their students.
Richard and his team wanted to make sure they created a buzz around the launch of Thrive, and cement in peopleâs minds that this was completely different from the uninspiring platform theyâd left behind. They kicked things off by uniting everyone with competitions and interactive challenges, which got the staff engaging with the platform from day one.
â
â
â
Results that canât be ignored
Engagement
Engagement was at the top of their list when it came to success metrics - a factor that had been sorely lacking with previous platforms.
Richard reviewed the
analytics
two weeks post-launch, and noticed that
in just those two short weeks, they had gained more learning completions than in an entire year using their previous platform.
By Richardâs own estimate, this is thanks to Thriveâs ease of use. Staff simply
enjoy
using the platform, meaning that they are regularly completing both essential learning and courses theyâve sought out completely independently.
For an organisation whose staff are spread out across multiple academies and counties, it was imperative that the platform help bring them together in a safe online space. Thrive was the only platform that allowed the trust to do this with ease, and encouraged the social engagement and knowledge sharing that they knew was essential to their learning strategy.
Fundamentally, this is what the trust is about: Learning and development.
â
Saving time
Time is their teacherâs most precious resource, so it was essential that any training went towards saving it. Thrive allowed them to introduce compliance training in a new, engaging format that could be quickly and thoroughly completed. This allowed the teachers more time to focus on localised issues when they returned to work.
â
Measuring effectiveness
Thriveâs
Data and Analytic
s allowed Richard to hone in on his learnersâ behaviour, truly analyse the effectiveness of the learning, and adjust accordingly. Within his Thrive Analytics Dashboard, he could see how many people were active, within what period, and behaviours broken down into time slots.
The team could then leverage this data to understand which academies within the trust were engaging with the platform well, and who needed more guidance.
â
Ongoing support
How do you ensure a successful implementation continues post-launch?
With their dedicated Customer Success Manager Steph and an entire Support team at their disposal, Leigh Academies Trust is able to tackle any issues that might arise - no matter how big or small.

Homebase
The DIY giants utilised Thrive's mobile functionality for their agile workforce, and increased customer satisfaction by 35%.
The name "Homebase" has been synonymous with the home and garden since its founding in 1979. A firm fixture in the British retail landscape, the DIY giants have 150 stores across the UK and Ireland and have been going from strength to strength - thanks in no small part to the emphasis they place on their team membersâ professional development.

A platform in need of renovation
The majority of Homebaseâs 5,600-strong team are customer-facing; their jobs entail assisting customers, dealing with stock, and solving queries as quickly as possible.
This incredibly agile workforce needed a platform that travelled the floor with them - not something that could only be accessed via one single computer in the back office.
As Homebaseâs previous LMS was not mobile-enabled, busy team members were pulled off the shop floor to use the storeâs designated computer - wasting their own time and keeping customers waiting.
Plus, the interface was clunky and difficult to navigate with onboarding compliance courses that left learners feeling uninspired. For an industry as fast-paced as retail, in a shop as popular as Homebase, this slower way of doing things just wasnât going to cut it.
The L&D project team headed up by
Richard Hanman
(L&D Business Partner at Homebase) knew that Homebaseâs platform should be as fluid and adaptable as its workforce, and allow them to access crucial content quickly.
It was time for their digital learning strategy to get a makeover.

A fresh coat of paint
As experts in renovation and improvement, Homebase knew where to begin when overhauling their learning strategy: they started with a shopping list.
They knew their requirements were:
Easy onboarding
Role-specific training
Upskilling
On-the-job learning
With these necessities in mind, Thrive looked to be the perfect fit for Homebase. The two things that initially piqued the Homebase teamâs interest were the platformâs ease of navigation and its mobile app. They knew it was non-negotiable that their learning platform worked perfectly on mobile, a must-have for their majority deskless workforce.
With their people at the heart of everything they do, Homebase wanted to make absolutely sure that Thrive was the best platform for their workforce. They rolled it out to a test audience of a select few learners before launch, and after a successful trial period Thrive got two (green) thumbs up.
The overwhelming feedback was that Thrive was extremely easy to navigate, and worked brilliantly on both desktop and mobile. (Tick, tick, tick!)
The team loved that it put the power back in the hands of the learners, and took training out of the managerâs office. Plus, managers could finally check individual learner analytics and data within the platform - something their previous LMS was sorely lacking.
What finally clinched it for them was the first-class support from the Thrive team, which continued throughout implementation, launch and beyond.
â
â
Planting the seeds for professional development
From day one to one year in, Homebase is committed to helping their team members flourish.
This all starts with a seamless onboarding experience, which Homebase has streamlined since launching Thrive.
Gone are the dry, boring compliance courses that were tedious for new starters to click through. Instead, theyâve been replaced by modern, engaging compliance content from the team at
Thrive Content
: Thriveâs off-the-shelf learning content solution.
Compliance is now effortlessly woven into the onboarding process and has become so much more than just a box-ticking exercise.
Finally, Homebase has compliance training that people actually want to complete.
For existing team members, Homebase makes sure to nurture their professional development in the way that best benefits them. Apprenticeship training, digital courses, on-the-job learningâ¦ Whatever it may be, Thrive has enabled them to supercharge this aspect of employee engagement with specific campaigns and pathways.
Homebase is so passionate about its peopleâs professional development, the first campaign they launched within Thrive was called âLearn at Work Month.â Initially, this was to give everyone the confidence to log in and navigate Thrive, but also to showcase the extra-curricular training that was available for team members.
â
Front of house
Homebase has teams both in support offices and in the stores - but the customer-facing frontline teams make up a very large percentage of the workforce, and are the faces of the operation. While those in the support office can access Thrive from their desktops, those on the shop floor need to be able to track down required learning quickly (without a mad dash to the managerâs office!)
In this respect, Thrive has been - in the words of the Homebase team members - a âgame changer.â An immeasurable amount of time is saved by team members being able to take the information on the go and access it from their pockets in two simple clicks.
Across the board, feedback from the Homebase team has been brilliant.
â
â
â
âIâm loving Thrive, itâs changed my life. Whenever I get asked to do a bit of training, Iâm straight on it!â
âSuch a leap forward from our previous platform!â
âAmazing. All works great with iPhone and Android.â
â
A design for success
The success of Homebaseâs launch of the Thrive platform is easily quantified thanks to Homebaseâs continuous collection of customer feedback. Every time a customer shops with Homebase, there is a link to complete a satisfaction survey on the back of the receipt.
What the team has found from this data since launching Thrive has been eye-opening.
The stores that have more team members trained to the âexpertâ level within Thrive consistently gain 35% higher satisfaction scores than those who donât.
This clearly communicated to the Homebase team that the more knowledgeable the customer service teams are, the higher the rating the customer tends to give for that visit. Not only does this knowledge increase customer satisfaction, but it even increases the average customer spend.
Whatâs next?
Homebase just launched Thrive six months ago, and already theyâre seeing fantastic results. The L&D team within Homebase is keen to keep this momentum going, and use Thrive to its full potential to help their teams achieve success.
Theyâre going to start building role-specific pathways for merchandisers and buyers, both of which are roles that have never before had any formal training. The Homebase team is excited to use Thrive to plug this gap, cultivating everyoneâs professional development.
Aside from role-specific training, they are also planning to streamline their platform so that itâs even easier for their teams to use - in the words of
Julia Turner
(Digital Learning Specialist at Homebase):
âWe want to make sure team members can get where they need to in a matter of seconds. Thrive is set up perfectly to provide that.â

Inspired Entertainment
The gaming and entertainment company levels up their learning with Thrive
Inspired Entertainment is a large games and entertainment company with 1,600 employees in offices spread out across the UK, US, Europe and India. Their one-of-a-kind games are supplied to approximately 50,000 machines in various venues throughout the world, as well as 170+ websites. Itâs safe to say that their reach is massive, and with 35 jurisdictions served worldwide, they have no plans of slowing down.
User Licenses
2,500
Region
EMEA
Legacy Platform
Other
Use Case
Training
Onboarding
Links
Time to level up their learning
Prior to launching Thrive, the Inspired teamâs learning and communication materials were spread out across email, a traditional LMS, and 50-60 page customer service handbooks.
This inconsistent and old-fashioned style of learning didnât match their vibrant, innovative and forward-thinking company ethos. Communications would often get lost in the shuffle - and for their incredibly busy 60-strong customer service team, thumbing through a handbook with a customer on the other end of the phone wasnât an efficient way to do their jobs.
They needed a learning platform that was as forward-thinking as their company: something that would bring their learning out of the past and beyond a box-ticking compliance exercise, into the bold future theyâd envisioned.
â
â
Not just another company
Laura Ramsden, Head of L&D at Inspired
, knew that the companyâs learning platform needed to match their own innovative ethos - and Thrive turned out to be the perfect fit. Lauraâs early interactions with the team at Thrive made it clear to her that it would be a supportive, successful partnership.
â
âI would recommend Thrive because of the support that you receive. It doesnât feel like âjust another companyâ, it really is a partnership.â
- Laura Ramsden, Head of L&D at Inspired
Throughout implementation and launch, Laura and her team recognised that their first challenge was changing the existing impression everyone had about the companyâs learning culture. With Thriveâs help, they wanted to reinvigorate their teams - and bring the gamification on which theyâd made their name into their learning strategy.
In order to get everyone involved from the very beginning, Laura rolled out a competition across the business to name the platform and win a prize. After the votes were counted, âiLearnâ took the crown - and Inspiredâs hyper-personalised learning platform was born.
The team loved how it reflected their brand, and how easy it was to continue that branding throughout the platform with features like âiDiscoverâ, âiLead,â âiQuestionâ and âiEvents.â
â
Hitting the skills jackpot
Learning at Inspired has been supercharged - with a strategy that has their learners feeling as though theyâve hit the jackpot.
With such a large and varied team, it was always imperative to Inspired that their learning platform cater to a diverse range of needs. The fact that Thrive facilitates content in multiple formats means that no matter how someone learns, they wonât get left behind - and the skills and goals functionality helps people level up in their careers.
â
Inspired has taken this functionality and run with it, rolling out âSkill of the Monthâ in order to regularly introduce the entire business to new skills they may need to develop. Topics like âFlexible Thinkingâ and âHaving Difficult Conversationsâ have proved invaluable to a company who actively encourages continuous development and upward mobility.
"We have a lot of people within the team who tend to progress to managerial roles ... so talking them through how to have more difficult conversations and building their confidence has been the best bit for us."
Rachel Hughes
, Customer Support Manager at Inspired

since launch

â
Achievements unlocked
As a games and entertainment company, Product underpins everything Inspired does - and Thriveâs communication features make it easier than ever for the Product team to share new game releases, marketing materials and trailers to keep everyone abreast of whatâs upcoming.
Inspired has teams in the UK, US, Europe and India, and so they saw launching iLearn with Thrive as the perfect opportunity to bring everyone together on one central platform. The iLearn homepage is buzzing with activity, and is
the
place to go for news, updates, and communications from all areas of the business.
Instead of emails getting lost under the digital rubble, company wins are given a place to shine - so that everyone can celebrate one anotherâs achievements together. And with Thriveâs collaboration features, two people from different sides of the organisation can connect and collaborate on relevant projects.
â
From level one to expert
Everyone knows starting a new job can be overwhelming - and Inspired really wanted to make sure that their players felt a part of the company culture right from âLevel One.â Instead of a quick onboarding process that simply introduces them to the basic expectations of their job role, new starters are met with a comprehensive pathway that provides a consistent experience to every single member of staff. This is complemented with job-specific training, to give them a well-rounded introduction.
This doesnât just stop after onboarding. Inspired continues to develop their people throughout their career, setting up monthly observations with team leaders where they can set out a development path. The framework helps everyone progress through their professional goals with smaller, bite-size objectives.
â
â
iLearn gets the high score
The engagement with iLearn has so far been fantastic. The team have found using the platform to be like second nature, making use of both the desktop version and the mobile app to help them take their learning on the go. The User Generated Content functionality makes it easy for everyone to feel like they have a voice and contribute to the platform, and the leaderboards make learning competitive - perfect for a gaming company!
Inspired is a hugely ambitious company in terms of growth, and the ability to see whatâs happening throughout all areas of the business makes everyone feel invested. In the words of
Lorna Evans
, VP of People at Inspired:
â
â
âInvest in your people, and theyâll invest in you.â

MyTutor
Fast growing virtual tuition provider MyTutor meets their perfect match as they streamline learning, collaboration and internal comms into an all-in-one platform.
MyTutor is the leading virtual tuition provider matching tutors with students for one-to-one tuition sessions all over the UK. Having doubled in size in just a year, it was their turn to find their perfect match: a new learning solution!
User Licenses
350
Region
EMEA
Legacy Platform
Use Case
Communication
Employee engagement
Learning
Compliance training
Links
Centralising a place for learning & communication
â
MyTutor wanted to provide wider access to a range of development opportunities for their 300+ people and as they were scaling so fast, they needed to overhaul Google Drive and streamline their learning into one place that would allow their staff to learn, connect and upskill.
User adoption
96%
active users and
4K
separate logins within the first 6 months
Content views
35K
content views and
13K
content completions within the first six months using Thrive
Employee communication
Over
13K
social interactions on company messages and posts within their first 6 months
A blended onboarding experience
â
â
After considering a range of different LMS's, the team at MyTutor knew they needed something with a second-to-none user experience that would help them deliver engaging and blended learning journeys. Artheka Sivaharan, Learning & Development Lead at MyTutor, commented:
â[Thrive] just stood out from the rest with how the Learning Platform looked and felt.â
Since deciding to implement Thrive, the team at MyTutor has overhauled onboarding from a PowerPoint to an interactive learning pathway packed with different blended resources and events. They can now easily track completions, communicate policies and connect people to each other in one place - meaning their new starters are getting up to speed faster!Â
â
Bringing in Thrive Content
â
In order to meet the demand for content the business was craving, the team at MyTutor needed an off-the-shelf learning solution along with their Learning Platform. But their requirements for volume needed to be backed up by quality, and more importantly be relevant to and engaging for their people. Enter Thrive Content.Â
With interactive quizzes, an extensive range of titles and media available and a service to map learning campaigns and pathways, they knew this would be the solution. It not only fills their content gaps, but they also have the support to map and create learning journeys which now make up 50% of their Learning Platform.
Artheka Sivaharan, Learning & Development Lead at MyTutor commented:
âI would describe Thrive ContentÂ  as having an extra person in the L&D team because of the easy access to training that's been produced to such a high standard.â
â
â
Supercharged support
â
â
Getting implementation right was key for MyTutor to get off to a flying start. The team at Thrive not only delivered training through interactive workshops, but helped carve out a marketing campaign for launch to ensure the best interaction from the get go.Â
MyTutorâs Platform is instrumental to keep employees up to date, engaged and informed with upskilling opportunities, business updates, and career progression. Since Go Live theyâve seen 96% adoption, 13K social interactions, 35K content views, and 13K+ content completions with an impressive 3,600 logins during this period.
The numbers speak for themselves, and learners feel like their personal development plans can come to life in a way that wasnât available to them before.

Middlesbrough College
Forward-thinking and ahead of the game, Middlesbrough College implements Thrive to overhaul their onboarding programme, ensure 100% compliance and foster a culture of learning.
Middlesbrough College's aim is to equip their students with the skills and qualifications they need to find success in their chosen field by offering courses for every occupational sector. Bringing students of all backgrounds, ages and ambitions together to learn, Middlesbrough College is fondly described by its principal as "a world under one roof."
User Licenses
1,350
Region
EMEA
Legacy Platform
Use Case
Compliance training
Continuing Professional Development
Onboarding
Corporate Social Responsibility
Links
Personalised learning at scale
As the largest college in Teesside with learning at the heart of what they do, Middlesbroughâs main objective when looking for a new learning management system was to create a culture of self-driven learning amongst staff and faculty. After careful consideration of the market, Middlesbrough College chose Thrive to supply them with a modern-day LMS individually tailored to their 1,200 learners.
An onboarding win
With a strong focus on delivering an engaging onboarding experience right from day one, Middlesbrough College wanted a digital solution to get new staff up to speed and fast. Natalie James, Workforce Development at Middlesbrough College, commented:
âThe induction process has become super relevant and inclusive for everyone who joins Middlesbrough.â
Transforming compliance training
Since launching Thrive, the team at Middlesbrough College has overhauled their existing induction process and replaced it with interactive pathways. With blended resources and events, the pathways are the perfect way for employees to work through their own learning at their own pace. Furthermore, the college has managed and tracked essential compliance training such as Safeguarding, E&D awareness, Health & Safety and more with total ease, ensuring their auditors have the reporting they need and all employees are up to date.
User adoption
90%
platform adoption rate within the first 3 months
Content views
165K+
Content views by users
Content completion
100%
Â completion of crucial compliance topics such as Safeguarding
Results and impact
Since Thrive has been deeply ingrained within the College, the impact and results have been impressive. With 165,000 content views, a remarkable 90% platform adoption rate, and nearly 100% of learners completing crucial topics such as Safeguarding, Middlesbrough College can confidently assert they have achieved compliance goals.
Bringing in Thrive Content
Lastly, Middlesbrough College also embedded Thrive Content, a valuable off-the-shelf content library that provides learners with relevant and practical content on important topics such as equality and diversity, information security, LGBTQ+ awareness, safeguarding, data protection, health and safety, fire safety and more. This comprehensive solution enables Middlesbrough College to bolster their learning pathways and deliver impactful training that truly engages their staff and encourages positive behaviour change.

âWeâve seen many different platforms on the marketplace but we knew we needed something thatâs so much more than just an LMS. Thrive has helped us revolutionise our learning culture here across our staff population, learning is now something you are an active owner of and you drive yourself rather than something thatâs done to you.â

SoPro
Fast growing and sales savvy lead generation business SoPro centralised their learning offering to increase access to training and scale up onboarding.
SoPro is B2B sales engagement platform, with headquarters in London, Brighton, Miami, Skopje, and Dubai. They conduct highly personalised email outreach to connect their clients with prospects, and help them to achieve business success.
User Licenses

Links
Building a âgo toâ place for learning
As a collaborative organisation, SoPro identified a need for a platform that would enable them to make their learning accessible and encourage peer-to-peer knowledge sharing. Learning was taking place across different teams, but there was a lack of consistency which meant there were silos that needed breaking down. The team identified Thrive as a partner to help them on their journey, and loved the early exploration sessions where they were able to hone in on exactly what was going to help them succeed.
â
User adoption
98%
Â user adoption since starting with Thrive
Content views
Over
60,000
content views
Content shares
Over
500
content shares
Scaling up onboarding and talent mobility
The company has been growing fast, bringing a new set of challenges for the team to meet. Since August 2022, they've welcomed over 150 new starters with a globally-consistent 'welcome' pathway to introduce them to the business.
With information on the business culture and values, well-being & inclusion initiatives, teams, offices and the structure of their first 90 days, new starters are immediately given the tools they need to hit the ground running.
Welcoming large numbers of employees meant they had to facilitate faster speed to competency, and look at reducing the overall cost of onboarding. Â
The team was also keen to enable skill development within the organisation - both for the roles people are already in, but also to help employees move into new areas across the business. Thrive has given them the tools they need to make this happen - and SoPro has run with it. Offering toolkits designed to prepare line managers and employees for career conversations, they've set their people up to excel in their chosen career paths. It's safe to say these toolkits are a success, amassing 1,500 views.
â
User generated content
SoPro already had a desire within the leadership team to enable user-generated content and peer learning across the teams. With Thrive in place, itâs much easier for them to encourage UGC - and theyâre consistently finding that they donât have to work hard to get people using the platform. Â A great early example has been a video competition run through the platform, which was based solely on users generating and uploading their own content.
â
Wellbeing, diversity and inclusion
In an effort to cultivate a culture of wellbeing, diversity and inclusion, SoPro has allocated specific 'Wellbeing Champions' within the business who can provide non-judgmental, confidential chats to anyone who might be struggling.
Utilising Thrive's custom-built pathways on these very topics, the team at SoPro train their people in the topics that matter most to them as a business. Everything takes place within the Thrive platform, so it's easy to access and refer back to later.
The results for these specific campaigns have been phenomenal, garnering over 7000 views - and the engagement with the platform overall have been just as impressive. Since launch, SoPro has gained 500 comments, over 400 shares, nearly 3,000 likes and over 60,000 views.
â

Wirral Council
Wirral Council use Thrive to connect 4,000 remote workers, creating one digital place for learning, knowledge sharing and collaboration on the move.
Wirral Council is a medium-sized council in the North West of England, just across the Mersey from Liverpool, employing 4,000 people and 450 teams. From social workers and planners to school crossing patrols, finance teams and IT, most of these people work remotely with varying digital literacy levels, varying access to tech, and a huge range of areas to consider in their learning strategy.
User Licenses
5,000
Region
EMEA
Legacy Platform
Learning Pool
Use Case
Compliance training
Learning
Skills development
Social learning
Links
â
â
â
2025 targets for diverse dispersed teams
â
Wirral Council has ambitious targets to meet in 2025, and wide-scale transformation plans around the delivery of services and regeneration of key areas. To realise those, the L&D team wanted people to be curious, empowered to develop their potential, and confident enough to â#BeTheDifferenceâ. But in a 2021 survey, only 56% of their employees felt they had good opportunities to grow. There was a disconnect between their people and the experts around the organisation. Their old LMS had limited capabilities, content was hard to find, and a user experience feedback form signalled one thing: it was time for an upgrade.
Remote learning
Used Thrive to help educate
4,000
remote workers
Content views
Average user is viewing
15
pieces of unique content a month
User adoption
80%
user adoption within the first 4 months
Setting the vision
â
The team set out to âcreate a culture of innovation and learning by fostering an agile and growth mindset.â This would then feed into a strong internal talent pipeline, built by enabling personalised, self-directed learning, free-flowing knowledge sharing through user-generated content, and simple, slick, Council-wide collaboration. With remote teams to consider, tech held the answer, and they found it in THRIVE. They named their new, fully branded platform âFLOâ (Flexible Learning Online) because it makes learning easy to access, impactful and engaging - all in the flow of work.
â
A team in full 'FLO'
â
Since launching at the beginning of 2022, FLO has become the place to be at Wirral Council in order to develop your knowledge and skills while connecting, collaborating and sharing with others.
Before, the L&D team had to push learning. Now, theyâre simply enabling it by using FLO to put personalised, bite-sized resources at their peopleâs fingertips. Featuring content from Thrive, other top providers in the industry, and Wirral Councilâs own experts, FLO is a one-stop-shop for multiple learning resources.Â
Thriveâs mobile app means all their employees can access those opportunities wherever they may be, and by creating a culture of self-directed, social learning, FLO has given Wirral Council all the tools they need to smash their targets come 2025.

"We needed a platform to help our people collaborate, learn at their own speed and be the difference in our ambitious plans. THRIVE was the perfect solution and the support from the team has been excellent."

Krispy Kreme
The doughnut giants wanted a Learning Platform that hit the sweet spot between collaboration, engagement and compliance.
When you think of doughnuts, chances are you think of Krispy Kreme. The famous doughnut chain has been operating since 1937 with a secret New Orleans recipe - and all these years later, they've expanded to 14,000 stores worldwide.
User Licenses
2,000
Region
EMEA
Legacy Platform
Use Case
Compliance training
Leadership development
Social learning
Onboarding
Training
Links
From tired LMS to Thrive
For doughnut and coffee lovers (so thatâs everyone, right?) Krispy Kreme needs little introduction. But with over 1,800 learners, operations in over 115 locations, and factory stores in key cities including Manchester, Birmingham, Bristol, Edinburgh, Newcastle and Leeds, they needed a Learning Platform that engaged their people and filled the holes in their dinosaur LMS; a platform that would become intrinsic to their learners' daily routine - and stop their eyes glazing over. Enter Thrive.
User adoption
99%
adoption rate by users within the first 6 months of using Thrive
Content views
610,685
content views by their learners since go live
Content sharing
1,985
content shares by their staff helping to encourage others to learn and grow
Compliance data was a big issue
Krispy Kremeâs old learning platform wasnât providing the level they required. In a culture that prides itself on employee engagement and high performance, they wanted to enable self-driven learning, collaboration and knowledge sharing in one, co-created place.
â
â
"We felt confident we were making the right decision"
We already had a great relationship with the Krispy Kreme team, because theyâve been using Thrive Content since April 2019 to share bite-sized learning resources in the flow of work. That meant theyâd already experienced the Thrive service - and they already knew the platform would be a great fit. From there, moving over to Thrive became a no-brainer, and with plans to expand to over 3,000 learners in the future, weâre delighted to give everyone at Krispy Kreme a learning experience that has them licking their lips!

Yopa
Award-winning estate agents Yopa Property upgraded from Moodle and saw a 3,900% increase in content views.
Yopa has become one of the largest estate agencies in the UK by offering the same end-to-end service you get from high street agencies, online. Their award-winning service covers everything from valuation to moving in day, all for a fair fixed fee.

Time for change
With cutting edge technology at the core of Yopa's business, their outdated Moodle learning management system just wasnât keeping up. They needed something new to help shift the way their business viewed learning and development.
Embedding social learning
With over 350 users, Yopa Property comprises a range of teams dispersed across the UK, including self employed, field-based local estate agents and two office locations for internal customer service and support function staff. They needed a way to drive engagement, bring scattered knowledge together and create a sense of community between teams, especially amongst their self-employed staff. Â
Social learning was the answer, and Thrive was the learning platform to help them achieve it. Enabling and empowering a new way of learning, Thrive ensures knowledge is streamlined and shared amongst teams. Yopaâs Director of Learning and Development Angela Toghill commented:
â
âMost of us are in a remote working environment and Thrive has given us the opportunity to collaborate, communicate and really build a sense of community here at Yopa.â
Better user engagement
80%
engagement rate from their users
Increase in content views
3,900%
increase in views since moving from Moodle to Thrive
Instant results
4,000+
content views in the first 2 weeks
Simple and intuitive
To be confident their new learning platform would land with modern learners, Yopa knew it had to be easy to use. The user experience needed to be simple and intuitive so it wouldnât only empower their people to consume useful content, but encourage them to share knowledge through their own user generated content. Angela Toghill commented:
âItâs simple, itâs intuitive and it reminds our users of the social channels they know and love.â
â
Launching YopaThrive
Following a smooth implementation, the brilliant L&D team at Yopa planned a jam-packed launch campaign to give Thrive the best start possible. The campaign kicked off at their annual âSmall Change, Big Gainsâ roadshow, where they introduced YopaThrive by branding brunch boxes and talking about the objectives for the new platform in a company wide digital event.
â
Achieving results from day one
Yopa ran challenges and competitions throughout their launch campaign, including finding hidden emojis amongst content and learner of the week. All of this activity resulted in a winning start to the launch of their new LMS, including an 80% engagement rate and 4,000+ content views in the first 2 weeks. Thatâs a 3,900% increase compared to Moodle, their previous LMS. Itâs safe to say the team at Yopa are embracing social learning. Information is no longer siloed; itâs shared, celebrated and available for everyone to find wherever theyâre working. We canât wait to see what this inspirational company achieves next.

Ann Summers
Iconic lingerie and adult toy brand chooses Thrive to transform learning and onboarding for its international teams.
Ann Summers has been blazing the trail for female empowerment for decades. Founded in 1970, the leading lingerie and adult toy brand has had a massive impact on erasing the taboos around female pleasure - and their success speaks for itself. With 80 stores across the UK, Spain and Ireland and plans to expand by five more in 2023, Ann Summers continues to prove that women everywhere want to normalise taking charge of their own sensuality.

Changed Retail
Underlines Magazine
Retail Technologies
A retail powerhouse
â
With over 1,000 frontline retail employees in the UK alone, Ann Summers needed to give them on-demand access to learning opportunities and key communications. Employees also needed the ability to connect and collaborate with their peers from day one, through onboarding and beyond.
Revenue
Sales increased by
10%
Â for stores using Thrive in a A/B learning test.
Strike rate
Learners using Thrive exceeded business target strike rate of
20%.
Engagement
Ann Summers has a
98%
adoption rate.
Measuring up for a snug fit
â
â
With so many employees who arenât desk-based, a solution that works as effectively on mobile as it does on a laptop was a key priority for the Ann Summers team.Â Â
Add to this bite-sized, visual content that their employees can engage with at their own speed, and they found the perfect fit for their learning culture in Thrive.
â
More collaboration. More opportunities to learn
â
With Thrive every new employee receives a personalised, frictionless onboarding experience, giving them access to the learning content they need to perform and progress their careers from day dot.
Whether theyâre in head office or on the shop floor, Ann Summersâ teams can connect, collaborate and learn from each other round the clock in an organic, social, user-driven way.
â
âInnovative. Revolutionary. Fresh.â
â
Ann Summersâ Learning & Development Partner Becky West said:
âWe are thrilled to be entering this partnership with Thrive, which will allow us to unite everyone with our learning strategy and streamline communication. We needed a mobile solution for our frontline staff, and we chose to work with Thrive because they are the most innovative solution out there for learning needs that correlate with our brand.âÂ
âFeedback from our initial super users has been fantastic. Straight away, they knew how to use it because Thrive is super intuitive and easy to use.â
â
Proving value
Having now been fully embedded with Thrive for over a year, Ann Summersâ engagement level amongst their learners has remained at an impressive 98%.
Throughout their journey with Thrive, Ann Summersâ L&D team noticed an important correlation: stores with the highest engagement rates demonstrated the highest level of performance. The opposite was also true, in that the lowest performing stores had the lowest engagement rates.
Knowing that they needed conclusive data to prove this correlation to their stakeholders, they levelled up their partnership and approached the team at
Thrive Impact
.
â
Enter Thrive Impact
Armed with years of experience in Data and Analytics, the Thrive Impact team visited Ann Summersâ head office for an on-site workshop. Together, they discussed the businessâ objectives and how Thrive Impact could help achieve them. This was not simply limited to L&D goals, but encompassed anything the business needed to achieve. After analysing the existing metrics and data, the decision was made to undertake a blended learning experiment.
â
A culture of experimentation
The aim of the experiment was simple: develop high performing teams who can deliver outstanding customer experiences. Ann Summers knew that their stakeholders would be compelled by an increase in strike rates for their Buzz Fresh and Hosiery lines, so they set out to demonstrate that their learning and development strategy could support them in achieving just that.
â
Existing strike rates:
14.8% on Buzz Fresh and Hosiery
Targeted strike rates:
20% on Buzz Fresh and Hosiery - with the exception of
Region 2
, which has a target of 22%.
â
For the experiment, Ann Summers stores were split into four regions, with Region 2 (The Test Group) receiving a slightly higher target than the others. All other regions were under the umbrella of The Control Group. While the Test Group received a blended learning approach comprising workshops, webinars and learning pathways, the Control Group only received the learning pathways. As the Ann Summers team was able to provide sales data for all regions, the Thrive Impact team could directly track the impact that the blended learning approach had had on the Test Group - and, hopefully prove that Learning and Development was the key to their success.
â
The results
The success of the experiment was easy to see and quantify. All regions (both those with the blended learning approach, and those with just the learning pathways) saw a year-on-year increase for both product lines. Most importantly, the Test Group who were undergoing the blended learning approach outperformed all other groups in the experiment for the Buzz Fresh line, and came in second place for the Hosiery lines.
By doing this experiment, Ann Summers were able to measure a 10% increase in revenue with Region 2 making Â£3,617 (over 36%) of that revenue - proving undeniably the positive impacts of their approach.
â
âBefore Thrive, we knew we had some fantastic training in our stores but we had no way to really measure the impact and check that all colleagues had participated in the training. But since implementing Thrive, we now have an easy way to measure the commercial impact our training has on our performance. We can get reporting on what training has been completed, at what level and when. This enables us to make informed decisions and drive future growth.â
â
â
Whatâs next?
Following the success of the experiment, Ann Summers and Thrive have been collectively shortlisted for
Best Use of Learning Analytics at the Learning Technologies Awards 2023
. Meanwhile, the team at Ann Summers continues to implement the culture of experimentation fostered during the Thrive Impact experiment, both within the Thrive platform and more widely across the organisation. Theyâre enthusiastic about the âtest and learnâ culture, so they can consistently improve and grow.
Ann Summersâ annual turnover has hit Â£100 million in 2023, and they have plans to open even more stores in the coming months.
â
H1 - 50/60
H2 - 40/50
H3 - 34/42

Becky West
Learning & Development Partner at Ann Summers
âI would definitely recommend Thrive to other organisations. All your learning is in one place and itâs incredibly social. Itâs a place where your teams will want to go to learn.â

The Rum Kitchen
The Caribbean-inspired restaurants use Thrive to give their people seamless, personalised access to the training they need.
Inspired by the ultimate street party, Notting Hill Carnival, and its journey to promote inclusivity and multiculturalism, Rum Kitchenâs mission is simple: âBE MORE CARNIVAL!â Today, they have four restaurants across London and Brighton that celebrate the bold signature flavours of the Caribbean, offering mouth-watering rum cocktails and jerk BBQ food, soundtracked by their brilliant resident DJs. At the heart of the experience: Rum Kitchenâs people.

A sensory slice of the islands
Â To truly honour the heritage of their menu and take their guests on a sensory journey, they had to connect their teams. Thrive allowed them to give them seamless access to the content, recipes and training they need, on demand and in the flow of work.
â
â
Their old LMS wasnât to their taste
â
Before moving to Thrive, Rum Kitchen was using Litmos LMS. But the platform wasnât easily customisable, the user interface was clunky, and the close-knit customer support Rum Kitchen craved just wasnât there. So they started to look at upgrading to a platform that was intuitive for their mostly Gen-Z learners; empowering them to create and share their own content and interact with each other, with the ability to customise learning pathways. It had to be accessible on any device, with support for a rich array of multimedia formats, and it had to provide personalised recommendations to give their people valuable skills and product knowledge, whether theyâre in the kitchen, on the bar, front of house, or on the move.
â
Content views
The average user views
19
pieces of content a month
User adoption
82%
Â user adoption within the first 6 months of using Thrive
Staff training
All restaurants have used Thrive to achieve a
5*
hygiene rating
â
The answer? Thrive.
By using our next-gen learning platform, Rum Kitchen made content like menus, recipes, allergen charts, knife skills, food safety and hygiene training instantly accessible to their people in one, digital place. In an industry that faces tough compliance measures and random hygiene spot checks, this is particularly important - and now, all of Rum Kitchenâs restaurants have been awarded a 5-star hygiene rating.
â
Continuous knowledge sharing
Rum Kitchen has also used Thrive to support their development paths named âThe Rum Agesâ, making sure their people could continue to progress and develop, even when they were physically apart through lockdown and limited opening hours. Thrive has also been used to connect The Rum Kitchenâs teams around the companyâs story and brand values. Campaigns including Black History Month highlight whatâs important to Rum Kitchen and its Caribbean culture, encouraging people to share their own ideas, content and inspiration in the process.

Bally's
Global casino-entertainment company Ballyâs transformed their learning strategy with Thrive, uncovering and understanding the impact of their L&D initiatives.
Bally's is a global, online gaming company operating across a number of locations. As their number of learners increased, the L&D team set out on a mission to let go of outdated learning processes and focus on delivering a modern, engaging learning experience for their workforce.
User Licenses
3,000
Region
EMEA
Legacy Platform
SAP Success Factors
Use Case
Compliance training
Onboarding
Learning
Social learning
Links
A partnership based on culture
â
With a closely aligned mission to meet the needs of the modern learner, Thrive was chosen to help deliver a scalable, social and user-driven learning strategy.
â
Driving up engagement
â
Scalability was important to the team at Ballyâs as the workforce grew, which meant that learner engagement was a key metric to see how effective their Learning Platform was. Previous learning technologies and training initiatives hadnât achieved the levels of engagement that the team was hoping for. Enter Thrive.Â
â
Shortly after implementing Thrive, the team quickly saw an increase in levels of adoption and users exploring the platform, and feedback from the learners showed that the user experience of the platform was key to this.
Proving real ROI
37%
average cost reduction in learning per hour
Onboarding time
Time to onboard staff dropped by
40%
Â vs their previous learning platform
Learning activity
10,000
content views a month with
92%
being user generated
Streamlining employee onboarding
â
As such a large organisation, successful onboarding at Ballyâs is a crucial part of the overall employee experience. With Thrive in place, new hires were given access to all the information they needed, packaged up in a way that made it personalised and relevant to them.
In addition, they were able to explore the platform based on their own interests and aspirations. Feedback from managers showed that new hires felt informed rather than overwhelmed, and the result was that they were up to speed and performing much quicker than previously.
â
The power of user-generated content
â
As part of their move to a more modern learning experience, Ballyâs was keen to remove the top-down, manager-led approach to delivering learning. Instead, they wanted to give their learners the tools and permissions to share their own content with their peers. The results spoke for themselves, and within the first month following implementation, over 100 pieces of content had been uploaded and shared within the workforce.
â
â
Proving real ROI
â
With a lean L&D team and tight resources available, it was important to Ballyâs to prove the impact that the new Learning Platform was having on the business. The results were clear early on, and they found that within the first two months of using Thrive to deliver their learning, the average cost per learning hour had been halved.
â
Bringing in Thrive Impact
â
â
Bringing in Thrive meant that the Ballyâs team had a lot more data on their learners and how they were engaging with learning initiatives. But lacking an in-house way of interpreting the data meant a missed opportunity to make more informed decisions and add more value. So they brought in Thrive Impact - Thriveâs customer-only service that provides experts from marketing, data and design - to help. For a fraction of the cost of an analyst, they found that the data team were able to help them make the switch from basic reporting to addressing real business challenges through their learning strategies.Â
â
Looking to the future
â
â
Ballyâs is a large organisation which is scaling fast, and continuously having to adapt to industry changes and trends. With those challenges at the forefront, the L&D team is focusing on ensuring their people are upskilling in the right areas and equipped to meet the needs of their clients. They plan to continue to build on their modern approach, using Thriveâs engaging user experience to deliver targeted and personalised learning to their global workforce.

Staffline
In partnering with Thrive, Staffline fostered self-directed learning and experienced 71% engagement within the first month.
Staffline is the UKâs leading provider of flexible blue-collar workers. Working with a range of industries, they supply approximately 40,000 staff per day to around 450 client sites in industries including agriculture, logistics and manufacturing.

More than just mandatory training
Until recently, mandatory training had dominated the learning agenda at Staffline - but it was time for a change. They needed to offer more technical, role-based learning as well as leadership and soft skills training for their 2,000 employees.
How Thrive met the challenge
Stafflineâs current compliance system was no longer meeting the needs of the business, or their learners. They wanted a new, modern learning platform that would implement a self-led learning culture while focussing on:
â
Self directed learning at the point of need
â
User-generated content
â
Modern learning experiences, with UI and UX that will wow their employees
â
Campaigns to help them market learning and make it engaging
â
Track learner history for line managers to encourage performance conversations
Together with Staffline, Thrive helped to deliver a slick, fully-branded learning experience platform that emulated the look and feel of social media channels, rather than a traditional LMS.
Barry Davison, Head of Learning and Development, called it
â
âthe Netflix of learningâ
â
to describe how much Thrive helped them mirror the experiences their employees have in their personal lives.
That doesnât only apply to look and feel; Staffline now offers a personalised approach to learning that uses AI to recommend relevant content to each individual.
Content completions
9,000
content completions one month after launch
â
Instant user engagement
71%
Â engagement rate from their users within the first month of using Thrive
Learning freedom
All staff now have
complete control
of their learning plan and career development within Thrive
Countdown to launch
The L&D team at Staffline ran a campaign titled âLearning is about to change in our businessâ 6 - 8 weeks before launching Thrive, in order to build intrigue and excitement for the roll-out. They also put together a focus group of learning influencers to get people talking, collect feedback and spread their marketing messages around the organisation. They launched in September 2020, and learners picked it up so quickly that they saw a 71% engagement rate and 9,000+ content completions in their first few weeks.
Now everyone at Staffline has control of their learning plan and career development. The team plans to maintain their high engagement rates, while driving usage through campaigns and their team of learning influencers.

Sumo Group
The award-winning games development company embedded a multi-award-winning, self-directed learning culture into their company.
Sumo Group is an award-winning games development company creating the industryâs most popular video games, including Sonic Racing, Little Big Planet and Hitman. In the last few years theyâve experienced rapid growth, taking them to over 1,400 employees and 17 video game development studios around the world.
User Licenses
2,000
Region
EMEA
Legacy Platform
Use Case
Onboarding
Employee engagement
Skills development
Social learning
Links
Rapid growth
With employees spread across the UK, Europe, India and Canada, the creative company needed a learning platform to surface employee expertise and share it across the entire company, connecting those in different locations.
Sumoâs vision
When looking for a new learning solution, Sumo found the more traditional learning management systems didnât have the social features they needed to fulfil their vision. Their key objective was to cultivate a culture in which learners are teachers, and everybody can take ownership of their own personal development. They also required a platform that could become their workplace hub for leaders to get their message out to the whole organisation.
Additionally, as a gaming company, UI and UX are at the heart of Sumo. So, it was crucial their learning system was engaging, easy to use and intuitive. They put a few learning platforms to the test and set out on a Thrive pilot with 45 employees. Jenny Muhlwa, Learning and Development Manager at Sumo Group, commented:
â
âUnanimously, Thrive came back as our provider of choice because of the great user experience, it was so easy to use and understand. We put it out to our people and asked how they felt about it. People said it was so intuitive and Iâm going to be coming back to it regularly, which was the key point for us.â
Content completions
Over
125,000
pieces of content have been completed with only
1%
Â being mandatory
Hiring smarter and promoting faster
42%
Â increase in overall talent and a
10%
Â increase in promotions for active learners
Social learning
Over
14K
social interactions including likes, shares, pins and comments
Learning and communication
Sumo Group teamed up with Thrive to embed a learning platform they named DOJO. This would bring to life a self-directed, social learning culture and enable improved communication across the business. With Thriveâs handy auto-curation tools, the L&D team were able to launch with a range of curated content, covering topics including wellbeing, equality, diversity and inclusion. Within the first 30 days, 89% of Sumo's people logged in and contributed 414 pieces of user-generated content, and since launch, 89% of the content on DOJO has been user-generated, with a 95% engagement rate.
From May 2020 to March 2022:
DOJO usage increased by
98.3%
There were
80,000
logins,
309,750
content views, and
29,211
searches on the platform
Sumo's people completed
127,600
pieces of content, less than
1%
of which was mandatory
They generated
14,300
social interactions, including likes, shares, pins and comments.
What's more, by highlighting L&D and DOJO during recruitment, they saw a
42%
increase in overall talent, and a
10%
increase in promotions compared to 2020-2021.
Spotify campaign to stay connected
Since launch, Sumo has delivered a range of creative learning initiatives to drive employee engagement. One campaign that was particularly popular was their DOJO Dukebox; a Spotify playlist embedded in Thrive with a weekly theme that learners can add songs to. This really brought their teams together and enabled their people to collaborate in social activities when working remotely, helping DOJO become not just the go-to place for learning, but the go-to social space for their people to connect.
From worlds apart to 'world class'
The positive impacts of DOJO were felt strongly in Sumo's employees' responses to The Sunday Times Top 100 Best Companies to Work For survey. From 2019 to 2021, Sumo's overall score went from 1 star (very good) to 3 stars (world-class). In 2022, they retained 3-star status and were named the 12th Best Large Company to Work For in the UK. Every survey category saw a sharp rise in scores, including 'personal growth', 'wellbeing' and 'leadership', showing DOJO accomplished what it set out to achieve: creating a place to meet others, share knowledge and develop through networks of learning.
â
An award-winning relationship
After utilising the services of our in-house team of Data Analysts as a part of our Thrive Impact service, Sumo were able to prove the impact of their learning activity - leading to our partnership winning two awards. Firstly, the Digital prize at the 2022 Learning Excellence Awards, then silver in 'Best Use of Digital Technologies' at the 2022 UK Employee Experience Awards.
â

"Unanimously, Thrive came back as our provider of choice because of the great user experience, it was so easy to use and understand. We put it out to our people and asked how they felt about it. People said it was so intuitive and I'm going to be coming back to it regularly, which was the key point for us.â
